intro: Thymelaea tarton-raira subsp. transiens, commonly known as the Transient Thymelaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Thymelaeaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
